facts.claim: Visu-Sewer was founded in 1975 by Ernest Alexander in Pewaukee, Wisconsin.
facts.evidence_text: User-provided company background summary cites founding in 1975 by Ernest Alexander in Pewaukee, WI.
source_refs: Fort Point Capital portfolio page (per user summary)
Story background text provided by user

facts.claim: Visu-Sewer differentiated early through adoption of hydro-jet flushing and CCTV inspection.
facts.evidence_text: User-provided background notes early adoption of hydro-jet and CCTV as pioneering technology.
source_refs: Company background text provided by user

facts.claim: Visu-Sewer is a portfolio company of Fort Point Capital.
facts.evidence_text: User summaries of press releases and portfolio description identify Fort Point Capital as owner.
source_refs: PR Newswire / Yahoo Finance mirror (per user summary)
Fort Point Capital portfolio page (per user summary)

facts.claim: Visu-Sewer acquired MOR Construction Services in late September/early October 2025.
facts.evidence_text: User-provided link summaries list multiple announcements dated 2025-09-30 to 2025-10-08 confirming the acquisition.

facts.claim: The MOR acquisition expands Visu-Sewer into Pennsylvania, Delaware, and New Jersey.
facts.evidence_text: User summaries explicitly name PA, DE, and NJ as new states added via MOR.

facts.claim: Financial terms of the MOR acquisition were not publicly disclosed.
facts.evidence_text: User summaries state there is no purchase price, EBITDA, or valuation released in the announcements.
source_refs: All MOR acquisition articles (per user summary)

facts.claim: Visu-Sewer was awarded an $18.1M Heart of the Valley interceptor rehabilitation contract in 2023.
facts.evidence_text: User summary cites Fox11 reporting an $18.1M municipal award.

facts.claim: A $50K VA contract record reflects pre-acquisition government services tied to Sheridan Plumbing & Sewer.
facts.evidence_text: User summary cites HigherGov record of $50K VA award dated 2022-07-29.

guardrails: Do not infer acquisition price, revenue, or EBITDA for MOR without additional sources.
Treat contract values as project-scale indicators, not valuation proxies unless explicitly modeled as assumptions.
